sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: A sphere has a radius of 5 cm. Find the volume of the sphere correct to one decimal place.
message_2:
The formula for the volume of a sphere is V = (4/3)πr³, where V is the volume and r is the radius.

Given the radius r = 5 cm, we can calculate the volume as follows:

V = (4/3)π(5³)
V = (4/3)π(125)
V ≈ 523.6 cm³

So, the volume of the sphere is approximately 523.6 cm³, correct to one decimal place.
